Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Shay Mavis at (269) 243-2725.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff restrain youth “too hard” leaving bruises on youth’s arms.
Youth does not currently have any injuries to her arms.
Approximately two weeks ago, youth was restrained by an
unknown staff member. Youth has bruising on inner thigh from the
restraint. Youth has not been evaluated medically due to the
bruises.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant became aware of the allegations during an
interview with Youth A at the facility regarding a separate
incident.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/10/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported she did not want to talk and provided limited information
during the interview. Youth A reported she felt safe at the facility.
Youth A reported the only concern she has with restraints at the
facility is when male staff restrain her in the upper torso hold
because the male staff restrain “too hard”. Youth A reported she
has told male staff restraints hurt however the male’s staff do not
ease up. Youth A would not provide any specific male staff
names and just stated “all male staff”. Youth A reported she would
not talk any further.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/10/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported she has been in one restraint while placed at the facility.
Youth B reported she was not hurt in any way during the restraint.
2

Youth B reported she has no concerns with any of the restraints
she has witnessed at the facility. Youth B reported she observed
Youth A get restrained Monday. Youth B reported Staff 1 and Staff
2 were in the restraint with Youth A. Youth B reported during the
restraint Youth A bit Staff 2 and Staff 2 used his hand to secure
Youth A’s head from being able to bite his shoulder. Youth B
reported she did not have any concerns with this restraint.
Assistant Facility Administrator was interviewed face-to-face
at the facility on 4/10/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS
Worker. Assistant Facility Administrator reported Youth A tends
to get restrained in “weird places” and explained Youth A has a
pattern of going into the road, laying down, and taking her clothes
off. Assistant Facility Administrator reported he’s aware of Youth
A's last three restraints which involved Staff 1, Staff 2 and himself.
Assistant Facility Administrator reported Youth A has never
reported any injuries or bruising following restraints. Assistant
Facility Administrator reported some female youth, no specific
youth identified, have complained of restraints being “too tight”
which tends to be a complaint when there is a height difference
between the youth and staff. Assistant Facility Administrator
reported when youth have complained of this and when possible,
staff have transitioned out of the restraint with another staff
member who is shorter in stature.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 4/10/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Chief Administrator reported no concerns have been brought to
his attention regarding restraints being “too hard”, “too tight” or
caused any injuries. Chief Administrator reported the restraints at
the facility have been trending down.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/10/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor
reported he has no concerns with any of the restraints he has
witnessed or been involved in at the facility, including no concerns
with any of Youth A’s restraints. Supervisor reported no youth,
including Youth A, have ever complained to him about injuries or
restraints. Supervisor reported no knowledge of Youth A ever
receiving any injuries during any restraints.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/10/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1
reported she is a restraint trainer at the facility. Staff 1 reported
she and Staff 2 restrained Youth A on Monday. Staff 1 reported
Youth A was placed in a hook transport hold by her and Staff 2 at
3

which time Youth A began kicking and was transitioned to a
supine restraint. Staff 1 reported no concerns with the restraint,
nor did Youth A report any injuries. Staff 1 reported as a restraint
trainer at the facility she has not been informed of any concerns
by youth or staff regarding male staff restraining “too hard”.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 4/24/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported he has
been in restraints with Youth A. Staff 1 reported he has placed
Youth A in single person restraint and a two-person restraint with
Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Youth A told him she was
going to report him to licensing for a recent restraint. Staff 2
reported he and Staff 1 restrained Youth A in the kitchen recently.
Staff 2 reported he and Staff 1 prompted Youth A to leave the
kitchen however Youth A refused and began throwing food and
kitchen items at staff. Staff 2 reported he and Staff 1 placed Youth
A in a bicep assist to escort Youth A from the kitchen, however
Youth A dropped to the ground and began kicking and punching
staff. Staff 2 reported Youth A was transitioned into a supine
restraint. During the restraint Youth A bit his arm (left latissimus
dorsi muscle/bicep). Staff 2 reported he rested his palm on Youth
A’s forehead to prevent her from biting him any further. Staff 2
reported Youth A was stating Staff 2 placed his elbow in her throat
however Staff 2 reported this was not accurate. Staff 2 reported
he restrained Youth A recently twice back-to-back as Youth A
attempted to run into oncoming traffic. Staff 2 reported Youth A
was placed in a single person upper torso restraint. Staff 2
reported Youth A was resisting in the restraint and later
complained of her shoulder being sore. Staff 2 reported he has
never had any concerns with the restraints he has witnessed at
the facility, no concerns with staff doing anything that would
intentionally harm a youth, or any staff using excessive force.
Staff 2 reported Youth A has never come to him with any reports
or concerns regarding bruising on her inner thighs from a restraint.
Staff 2 reported Supervisor and Assistant Facility Administrator
are taller than the female youth at the facility and due to their size
difference, when they restrain youth, it causes them to pull more
on the youth’s shoulders.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 4/23/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported she has no
concerns with any restraints she has witnessed at the facility with
any youth including Youth A. Staff 3 reported she has never
restrained Youth A. Staff 3 reported she has never witnessed any
staff do anything inappropriate during any restraints at the facility
including restraints with Youth A. Staff 3 reported Youth A has
4

never come to her with any concerns regarding restraints being
“too tight”.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 5/2/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported he has not
been involved in any restraints with Youth A. Staff 4 reported he
had a good rapport with Youth A and could verbally deescalate
her prior to a situation leading to a restraint. Staff 4 reported
Youth A had been restrained by staff including Assistant Facility
Administrator, Supervisor, and Staff 2, however he never
witnessed any of Youth A’s restraints. Staff 4 reported Youth A
never reported any concerns to him regarding any of the restraints
she had been in. Staff 4 reported he had heard several youth,
unable to provide any specific youth’s names, say staff restrain
with too much force. However, Staff 4 reported some of the
restraints he witnessed, the youth would be fighting back and
carrying staff on their back which he felt indicated there was not
enough force in the restraint. Staff 4 reported the restraints he
witnessed Assistant Facility Administrator and Supervisor
complete were always short in length as they would get into the
proper hold quickly and the restraint would end quick. Staff 4
reported no concerns with any restraints he witnessed at the
facility.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/10/2025
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Nurse reported she
examined Youth A on Tuesday following the allegations of Youth
A reporting bruising on her inner thigh area. Nurse reported Youth
A did not have any bruising. Nurse reported Youth A has what
appears to be a birthmark or chaffing in her inner thigh, not
bruising. Nurse reported she examines youth at the facility
following restraints and asks the youth if anything hurts and if the
youth report any concerns she documents the concerns on her
report. Nurse reported no youth have reported any concerns to
her regarding male staff restraining “too hard”.
Documents Reviewed:
• Review of MiSACWIS restraint incident reports for Youth A
physical restraints from 3/17/2025 through 4/7/2025
showed three restraints had occurred.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 209460241 dated 3/17/2025 for Youth A:
Youth A ran into the road with oncoming traffic
approaching. Staff 2 placed Youth A in an upper torso
restraint to prevent Youth A from being hit by oncoming
traffic. Youth A was resisting the restraint by throwing her
5

body from left to right and kicking Staff 2 in the legs. Staff 2
transitioned into a seated kneeling upper torso. Youth A
was assessed by nursing staff and no medical concerns
reported.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 209460242 dated 3/17/2025 for Youth A:
Youth A was released from a physical hold initiated by Staff
2. Youth A was placed in another upper torso restraint by
Staff 2 and Supervisor as Youth A was running in and out
of the road with oncoming traffic. Youth A was moved out
of the road to the side of the road and continued kicking her
legs and was transitioned into a seated kneeling upper
torso. Youth A was assessed by nursing staff and no
medical concerns reported.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 210030239 dated 3/27/2025 for Youth A:
Youth A was arguing with a peer and charged toward the
peer to fight and was placed in a single person upper torso
restraint by Staff 4. Youth A was assessed by Nurse and no
medical concerns reported.
• Youth Opportunity Investments Medical documentation for
Youth A dated 4/8/2025: Youth A stated she does not hurt
anywhere but does have bruises between thighs. Youth A
was evaluated by Nurse regarding bruising between legs
and there is no bruising however does have chaffing
between thighs. No marks, swelling, or bruising on body.
No complaints of pain.
• Youth Opportunity Nursing Progress Note for Youth A
dated 3/13/2025: Youth A has discoloration on inner aspect
of thigh which appears to be birthmark/chaffing.
• Youth Opportunity Nursing Progress Note for Youth A
dated 4/8/2025: Youth was evaluated for the bruising
between things and no bruising between or on thighs was
viewed. Youth does have chaffing between thighs, there is
no swelling, redness, or pain reported.
• Staff 1 and Assistant Facility Administrator’s personnel file:
Staff 1 and Assistant Facility Administrator had no
discipline in their personnel files. Staff 1 completed Safe
Crisis Management training on 4/28/2025 and Assistant
Facility Administrator on 3/19/2025 and 3/20/2025.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: Staff 2 had discipline dated
12/30/2024 and 1/17/2025 (unrelated to this investigation).
6

Staff 2 completed Safe Crisis Management training on
1/27/2025 and 1/28/2025.
• Staff 4’s personnel file: Staff 4 had discipline dated
3/20/2025 (unrelated to this investigation). Staff 4
completed Safe Crisis Management training on 3/19/2025
and 3/20/2025.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Youth A did not have any
bruising on her inner thigh per Nurse, and Youth A indicated male
staff restrain “too hard” however was not willing to provide further
information or specific situations or staff. No employees
interviewed had concerns regarding male staff restraining too
hard, and no employees had witnessed any inappropriate
restraints.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
The facility was offered technical assistance in continuing to
switch out staff when possible if the size difference between the
staff and youth results in the restraint causing pain to the youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification;
Section debriefing; reporting.
Description (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The facility did not complete the incident report within the required
timeframe.
Investigation Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 210030239 dated 3/27/2025 for Youth A:
Incident Reported was approved on 4/10/2025.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as the incident report was
dated 3/27/2025 and was not approved in MiSACWIS within the
72 hour requirement.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2024C0000939SI dated 1/12/2024, CAP Approved 2/12/2024
SIR 2024C0000956SI dated 1/29/2024, CAP Approved 2/12/2024
SIR 2024C0001140SI dated 4/11/2024, CAP Approved 5/9/2024
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
